chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dylan T. Madderom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dylan T. Madderom is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dylan T. Madderom was found guilty of Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Dylan T. Madderom in court & in custody with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF30, 15CF61, 15CF100 & 14CF186  @ 9:01 am.  15CF100 Need to waive p.h. Waiver of Preliminary Examination Filed.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause. Information Filed.  Atty Cveykus has copy of information & waives reading. State gives plea agreement 
14CF186 ct 2 15 years prison, 8 years initial confinement, 7 years extended supervision, Restitution to be determined within 60 days, No contact with victim or his family, AODA, counseling as appropriate by agent & costs, 321 days credit, Ct's 1, & 4 DRI, Ct 3 Dismissed, $10,000 moved to be forfeited. Victim Rights have been complied with.  15CF30 DRI all ct's. 15CF61 Victim Impact Statement Filed, DRI, $1372.80 Read  in 14CRF186, 25% wages to be applied to Restitution. Atty Cveykus would allow bond to be applied to restitution.  15CF100 Victim Impact statement filed, ct 1 6 years prison, 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, concurrent with 14CF186, Restitution $200, bond to be applied to restitution, no contact with victim, costs, 85 days credit. Atty Cveykus agrees with plea agreement, 14CF186 60 days to determined & 30 days for defense to object.  Bond of $5,000.00 to be forfeited to Langlade Co. & Restitution to be taken out & balance to be returned to father.  Def. understands plea agreement.  Plea questionnaire & waiver of rights filed.  Def. understands charges & penalties.  14CF186 Ct 2 Child Abuse-Intentionally great bodily harm, no contest plea, 15CF100 Battery by Prisoner, no contest plea.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights. Atty Cveykus is satisfied.  Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis stipulated.  Court finds factual basis, accept pleas to Child Abuse 14CF186 & Battery by Prisoners in 15CF100 & directs Clerk to enter Guilty. Victim mother has Victim Coordinator make statement. H.T. makes statement. State explains plea agreement. Atty Cveykus gives sentencing argument. Def. makes statement.  Court orders 14CF186, Ct's 1 & 4 DRI, Ct 3 Dismissed, 15CF61 DRI for sentencing & Restitution, 15CF30 DRI all 4 ct's, Court approves plea agreement, 14CF186 ct 2 15 years prison, 8 years initial confinement, 7 years extended supervision, Restitution to be determined within 60 days for State & defense has 30 days to object, $5,000 forfeited to Langlade Co., other $5,000 to be held for restitution & costs, No contact with victim (A.T.) or his family, if anything left over from bond return to poster. AODA &  counseling as appropriate by prison or agent & costs, 321 days credit. 
15CF100 ct 1 6 years prison, 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, concurrent with 14CF186, Restitution $200, bond to be applied to restitution & paid to victim, costs, no contact with victim (Q.A.) 85 days credit. Extended Supervision condition  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Def. is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Def. is not eligible for  the Substance Abuse Program
Court goes over Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  Def. advised of firearm, or body Armour & voting rights. DNA sample & surcharge on both ct's.   DNA colloquy. Def. advised of postconviction rights.  15CF61 Restitution read in of $1372.80 paid from bond. State will provide something for Restitution.  Bond to be applied to restitution 1st if nothing left over than will be condition of extended supervision & 25% wages to be applied to restitution & costs.

Defendant Dylan T. Madderom in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Defendant Dylan T. Madderom in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:03 p.m. Motion to forfeit bond. Arguments by Counsel. Court has read Def's brief. Court makes findings that bond to be forfeited. However, stays forfeiture order at this time. This case to track other files. 15CF100 called @ 2:04 p.m. off the record. Back on the record 2:16 p.m. Copy of complaint received, Atty Cveykus appears specially at this time, reading waived, time limits waived, reserve all juris. objections. Def agrees with waiver of time limits. State heard on bond. Asks for $1500 cash bond.  No objection. Court sets $1500.00 cash bond with no special conditions. All cases scheduled for status conference - 15CF30, 15CF61, 14CF186, 15CF100.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Pleas of Not Guilty and Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect and Request for Psychological Evaluation

Defendant Dylan T. Madderom in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Dylan T. Madderom in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls @ 1:54 pm. State is ready to proceed. T.D., duly sworn on oath, testifies. Andrew Hopfensperger, Jr. City of Antigo Police Dept., duly sworn on oath testifies. State asking that Ct 3 Attempt first degree intentional homicide, 940.01(1)(a) & gives facts. Atty Morgan has nothing at this time. Judge questions. State gives reason.  Court finds probable cause & binds over.  Information Filed. Atty Morgan has copy of information, waives reading & enters not guilty & not guilty by mental disease or defect.  Court enters both pleas. Court needs policy for Langlade County.  Atty Morgan thinks court may order.  Court will order mental examination.  Atty Morgan has def. records, Atty Morgan will need to get the medical records to Dr.  State does not object, & would like copies. Atty Morgan heard on to modify bond.  State replys. Court denies motion. Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Dylan T. Madderom in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Dylan T. Madderom in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Morgan will withdraw competency issue.  Preliminary hearing requested.   Request for bond modification.  Court will hear that at the time of preliminary.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 29, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

Attorney Andrew M. Morgan in court by phone.  Jill Louise Laufenberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was set for competency hearing.  Statement by Atty Morgan, records have been received.  Atty Morgan to contact Dr. Galli to appear by phone for competency hearing.  Traffic citations will follow  Competency hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Andrew M. Morgan in court by phone.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Morgan.  Atty Morgan is requesting additional medical records.  Matter to be adjourned.  Bond will continue  Competency hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
